SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.database.service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.database.service.UserService
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserRepository
public final class UserService extends Object implements UserRepository
Service class for managing User entities.

The UserService class implements the UserRepository interface, providing concrete methods for CRUD operations on User objects. It handles database interactions for the users table, including user retrieval, creation, and password validation.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Executes database queries for retrieving, saving, and validating User records.
  • Ensures data consistency and handles error logging during database operations.
  • Maps database result sets into User objects for use in business logic.

Design Pattern:

Implements the Singleton design pattern to ensure only one instance of the service exists during the applicationâ€™s lifecycle. Use getInstance() to access the singleton instance.

Usage Example:

 UserService userService = UserService.getInstance();
 List users = userService.findAll();
 Optional user = userService.findByUsername("username");
 userService.save("username", "password");
 boolean exists = userService.existsByUsername("username");
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      private UserService()
      Constructs the UserService.

      This private constructor enforces the Singleton pattern, ensuring that only one instance of the UserService exists during the application's lifecycle. Direct instantiation is prevented to centralize data access logic.

      Use getInstance() to obtain the singleton instance.

      Design considerations:

      • Encapsulates all User database operations in a single service.
      • Reduces redundancy and centralizes database access logic.
      See Also:
      • getInstance()
      • UserRepository

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static UserService getInstance()
      Provides the singleton instance of the UserService.

      If the instance is null, a new UserService is created. Subsequent calls to this method will return the same instance. This ensures consistent access to shared resources, such as database connections.

      Usage Example:

       UserService userService = UserService.getInstance();

      Thread Safety:

      This method is not inherently thread-safe. Ensure external synchronization if used in a multi-threaded environment.

      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the UserService.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if initialization fails due to unexpected errors.
      See Also:
      • UserService
      • UserRepository

    • findAll

      public List<User> findAll()
      Retrieves all User records from the database.

      This method executes the UserQuery.FIND_ALL SQL query to fetch all rows from the users table. Each row is mapped to a User object using the map(ResultSet) method. If an SQL error occurs during execution, an empty list is returned, and the error is logged.

      Performance Considerations:

      • Large datasets may impact performance; consider using pagination for scalable solutions.
      • Efficiently processes ResultSet to reduce memory overhead.
      Specified by:
      findAll in interface UserRepository
      Returns:
      a List of all User entities, or an empty list if none are found or if an error occurs.
      See Also:
      • User
      • UserQuery.FIND_ALL
      • map(ResultSet)

    • save

      public void save(String username, String password)
      Saves a new User to the database.

      This method hashes the password before saving it using PasswordUtil.hashPassword(String). It executes the UserQuery.SAVE_USER SQL query to insert the user into the users table.

      Specified by:
      save in interface UserRepository
      Parameters:
      username - the username to save.
      password - the password to save.
      See Also:
      • User
      • UserQuery.SAVE_USER

    • existsByUsername

      public boolean existsByUsername(String username)
      Checks if a User exists in the database by their username.

      Executes the UserQuery.EXISTS_BY_USERNAME SQL query to count records with the specified username in the users table.

      Specified by:
      existsByUsername in interface UserRepository
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check.
      Returns:
      true if the user exists, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • UserQuery.EXISTS_BY_USERNAME

    • findById

      public Optional<User> findById(Long id)
      Finds a User by their unique ID.

      Executes the UserQuery.FIND_BY_ID SQL query to retrieve the user with the specified ID from the users table.

      Specified by:
      findById in interface UserRepository
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the user to find.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the User if found, or an empty Optional if not found.
      See Also:
      • UserQuery.FIND_BY_ID

    • findByUsername

      public Optional<User> findByUsername(String username)
      Finds a User by their username.

      Executes the UserQuery.FIND_BY_USERNAME SQL query to retrieve the user with the specified username from the users table.

      Specified by:
      findByUsername in interface UserRepository
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to find.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the User if found, or an empty Optional if not found.
      See Also:
      • UserQuery.FIND_BY_USERNAME

    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword(User user, String password)
      Verifies if the provided password matches the hashed password of the given User.

      The password is hashed using PasswordUtil.hashPassword(String) and compared to the stored hash.

      Specified by:
      checkPassword in interface UserRepository
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose password is to be verified.
      password - the plain-text password to verify.
      Returns:
      true if the password matches, false otherwise.

    • map

      private Optional<User> map(ResultSet result) throws SQLException
      Maps a row in the ResultSet to a User entity.

      This method extracts data from the ResultSet and creates a new User object with its fields populated from the database columns.

      Parameters:
      result - the ResultSet containing user data.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the mapped User, or an empty Optional if the result set is empty.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while accessing the result set.
      See Also:
      • User
      • ResultSet
